10 /// </summary>
11 public class MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence
12 {
13 public int ShortPeriod { get; }
14 public int LongPeriod { get; }
15 public int SignalPeriod { get; }
16
17 public List<decimal?> MacdLine { get; } = new();
18 public List<decimal?> SignalLine { get; } = new();

21 public MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence(int shortPeriod = 12, int longPeriod = 26, int signalPeriod = 9)
22 {
23 if (shortPeriod <= 0 || longPeriod <= 0 || signalPeriod <= 0)
24 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException("Periods must be greater than 0");
25 if (shortPeriod >= longPeriod)
26 throw new ArgumentException("ShortPeriod must be less than LongPeriod");
27​
28 ShortPeriod = shortPeriod;
29 LongPeriod = longPeriod;
30 SignalPeriod = signalPeriod;
31 }

33 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
34 {
35 MacdLine.Clear();
36 SignalLine.Clear();
37 Histogram.Clear();
38​
39 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
40 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
41​
42 // Rationale: MACD is composed of EMAs. We verify using the helper method.
43 // 1. Calculate Fast EMA (e.g. 12)
44 var shortEma = CalculateEma(candleList, ShortPeriod);
45
46 // 2. Calculate Slow EMA (e.g. 26)
47 var longEma = CalculateEma(candleList, LongPeriod);
48​
49 // 3. Calculate MACD Line (Fast - Slow)
50 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
51 {
52 if (i < shortEma.Count && i < longEma.Count &&
53 shortEma[i].HasValue && longEma[i].HasValue)
54 {
55 MacdLine.Add(shortEma[i]!.Value - longEma[i]!.Value);
56 }
57 else
58 {
59 MacdLine.Add(null);
60 }
61 }
62​
63 // 4. Calculate Signal Line (EMA of MACD Line)
64 // Note: Reuse EMA logic but on 'Values' (MACD) instead of 'Candles' (Close).
65 CalculateEmaFromValues(MacdLine, SignalPeriod, SignalLine);
66​
67 // 5. Calculate Histogram (MACD - Signal)
68 for (int i = 0; i < MacdLine.Count; i++)
69 {
70 if (MacdLine[i].HasValue && i < SignalLine.Count && SignalLine[i].HasValue)
71 {
72 Histogram.Add(MacdLine[i]!.Value - SignalLine[i]!.Value);
73 }
74 else
75 {
76 Histogram.Add(null);
77 }
78 }
79 }

1// =============================================================================
2// Logic Breakdown (MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence - MACD)
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6// MACD (Moving Average Convergence Divergence) technical indicator.
7// We explain *why* code is written this way and *how* data transforms
8// line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
9//
10// [Core Concepts]
11//
12// 1. What is MACD?
13// [Creator] Gerald Appel (1979)
14// [Purpose] Shows the relationship between two EMAs to identify trends.
15// [Why Popular?] All-in-one: Trend direction, strength, and momentum.
16//
17// 2. The Three Components
18//
19// | Component | Formula | Default |
20// |--------------|----------------------------------|---------|
21// | MACD Line | EMA(12) - EMA(26) | - |
22// | Signal Line | EMA(MACD Line, 9) | 9 |
23// | Histogram | MACD Line - Signal Line | - |
24//
25// 3. Visual Understanding
26//
27// [MACD Line Concept]
28//
29// Price: ___/‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾\___
30// Short EMA: ___/‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾\___ (Fast, follows price closely)
31// Long EMA: ____/‾‾‾‾‾\____ (Slow, lags behind)
32// MACD Line: The GAP between them (Short - Long)
33//
34// When Short > Long: MACD is positive (bullish)
35// When Short < Long: MACD is negative (bearish)
36//
37// 4. Signal Interpretation
38//
39// | Signal | Meaning |
40// |----------------------|---------------------------------|
41// | MACD crosses Signal↑ | Buy signal (bullish crossover) |
42// | MACD crosses Signal↓ | Sell signal (bearish crossover) |
43// | Histogram growing | Trend is strengthening |
44// | Histogram shrinking | Trend is weakening |
45//
46// [Data Flow Diagram]
47//
48// CandleData[]
49// ↓
50// ┌─────────────┐ ┌─────────────┐
51// │ Short EMA │ │ Long EMA │
52// │ (period=12) │ │ (period=26) │
53// └──────┬──────┘ └──────┬──────┘
54// │ │
55// └───────┬───────────┘
56// ↓
57// MACD Line = Short - Long
58// ↓
59// ┌──────────────┐
60// │ Signal Line │
61// │ EMA(MACD, 9) │
62// └──────┬───────┘
63// ↓
64// Histogram = MACD - Signal
65//
66// =============================================================================
67​
68using System;
69using System.Collections.Generic;
70​
71namespace TechnicalIndicators
72{
73 // =============================================================================
74 // Logic Explanation: OHLCV Data Container
75 // =============================================================================
76 public readonly record struct CandleData(
77 DateTime Timestamp,
78 decimal Open,
79 decimal High,
80 decimal Low,
81 decimal Close,
82 long Volume
83 );
84​
85 // =============================================================================
86 // Logic Explanation: MACD Class
87 // =============================================================================
88 public class MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence
89 {
90 // -------------------------------------------------------------
91 // Logic Explanation: Configuration
92 //
93 // [Default Values] 12, 26, 9 were chosen by Gerald Appel.
94 // 12 = ~2 weeks, 26 = ~1 month, 9 = Signal smoothing
95 // -------------------------------------------------------------
96 public int ShortPeriod { get; }
97 public int LongPeriod { get; }
98 public int SignalPeriod { get; }
99​
100 // Three output lists
101 public List<decimal?> MacdLine { get; } = new();
102 public List<decimal?> SignalLine { get; } = new();
103 public List<decimal?> Histogram { get; } = new();
104​
105 // =============================================================================
106 // Logic Explanation: Constructor
107 // =============================================================================
108 public MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence(int shortPeriod = 12, int longPeriod = 26, int signalPeriod = 9)
109 {
110 // [Validation] All periods must be positive
111 if (shortPeriod <= 0)
112 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(shortPeriod), "ShortPeriod must be greater than 0");
113 if (longPeriod <= 0)
114 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(longPeriod), "LongPeriod must be greater than 0");
115 if (signalPeriod <= 0)
116 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(signalPeriod), "SignalPeriod must be greater than 0");
117
118 // [Logical Constraint] Short must be less than Long
119 // Otherwise the concept doesn't make sense.
120 if (shortPeriod >= longPeriod)
121 throw new ArgumentException("ShortPeriod must be less than LongPeriod");
122​
123 ShortPeriod = shortPeriod;
124 LongPeriod = longPeriod;
125 SignalPeriod = signalPeriod;
126 }
127​
128 // =============================================================================
129 // Logic Explanation: Main Calculation Method
130 // =============================================================================
131 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
132 {
133 // -------------------------------------------------------------
134 // Step 1: Cleanup
135 // -------------------------------------------------------------
136 MacdLine.Clear();
137 SignalLine.Clear();
138 Histogram.Clear();
139​
140 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
141 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
142​
143 // -------------------------------------------------------------
144 // Step 2: Calculate Short and Long EMAs
145 // -------------------------------------------------------------
146 var shortEma = CalculateEma(candleList, ShortPeriod);
147 var longEma = CalculateEma(candleList, LongPeriod);
148​
149 // -------------------------------------------------------------
150 // Step 3: Calculate MACD Line
151 //
152 // [Formula] MACD = Short EMA - Long EMA
153 //
154 // [Null Handling] Both EMAs must be valid to calculate MACD.
155 // -------------------------------------------------------------
156 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
157 {
158 if (i < shortEma.Count && i < longEma.Count &&
159 shortEma[i].HasValue && longEma[i].HasValue)
160 {
161 MacdLine.Add(shortEma[i]!.Value - longEma[i]!.Value);
162 }
163 else
164 {
165 MacdLine.Add(null);
166 }
167 }
168​
169 // -------------------------------------------------------------
170 // Step 4: Calculate Signal Line (EMA of MACD Line)
171 // -------------------------------------------------------------
172 CalculateEmaFromValues(MacdLine, SignalPeriod, SignalLine);
173​
174 // -------------------------------------------------------------
175 // Step 5: Calculate Histogram
176 //
177 // [Formula] Histogram = MACD Line - Signal Line
178 //
179 // [Visual: Histogram Interpretation]
180 //
181 // Histogram: ████████ (MACD > Signal = Bullish)
182 // ████████
183 // ████
184 // ───────────████────────── ← Zero
185 // ████
186 // ████████ (MACD < Signal = Bearish)
187 // -------------------------------------------------------------
188 for (int i = 0; i < MacdLine.Count; i++)
189 {
190 if (MacdLine[i].HasValue && i < SignalLine.Count && SignalLine[i].HasValue)
191 {
192 Histogram.Add(MacdLine[i]!.Value - SignalLine[i]!.Value);
193 }
194 else
195 {
196 Histogram.Add(null);
197 }
198 }
199 }
200​
201 // =============================================================================
202 // Helper Method: CalculateEma (from Candle Data)
203 //
204 // [IPO Block]
205 // Input: List<CandleData> candles, int period
206 // Process: Standard EMA calculation on Close prices
207 // Output: List<decimal?> of EMA values
208 //
209 // [EMA Formula]
210 // k = 2 / (period + 1)
211 // EMA = (Price - PrevEMA) × k + PrevEMA
212 // First EMA = SMA of first 'period' closes
213 // =============================================================================
214 private static List<decimal?> CalculateEma(List<CandleData> candles, int period)
215 {
216 var results = new List<decimal?>();
217 if (candles.Count == 0 || period <= 0) return results;
218​
219 decimal k = 2.0m / (period + 1);
220 decimal? prevEma = null;
221​
222 for (int i = 0; i < candles.Count; i++)
223 {
224 // [Phase A] Warmup period
225 if (i < period - 1)
226 {
227 results.Add(null);
228 continue;
229 }
230​
231 // [Phase B] Bootstrap with SMA
232 if (i == period - 1)
233 {
234 decimal sum = 0;
235 for (int j = 0; j < period; j++)
236 sum += candles[i - j].Close;
237
238 prevEma = sum / period;
239 results.Add(prevEma);
240 continue;
241 }
242​
243 // [Phase C] Recursive EMA
244 if (prevEma != null)
245 {
246 decimal ema = (candles[i].Close - prevEma.Value) * k + prevEma.Value;
247 results.Add(ema);
248 prevEma = ema;
249 }
250 else
251 {
252 results.Add(null);
253 }
254 }
255 return results;
256 }
257​
258 // =============================================================================
259 // Helper Method: CalculateEmaFromValues (from decimal? list)
260 //
261 // [IPO Block]
262 // Input: List<decimal?> source, int period, List<decimal?> results (output)
263 // Process: EMA calculation that handles nulls in source
264 // Output: void (populates 'results' list)
265 //
266 // [Why Reference Parameter?]
267 // Allows caller to pass the output list to be populated.
268 // Avoids creating a new list internally.
269 //
270 // [Null Handling]
271 // Counts only valid (non-null) values for warmup.
272 // =============================================================================
273 private static void CalculateEmaFromValues(List<decimal?> source, int period, List<decimal?> results)
274 {
275 results.Clear();
276 if (source.Count == 0 || period <= 0) return;
277​
278 decimal k = 2.0m / (period + 1);
279 decimal? prevEma = null;
280 int validCount = 0;
281​
282 for (int i = 0; i < source.Count; i++)
283 {
284 // Skip nulls in source
285 if (!source[i].HasValue)
286 {
287 results.Add(null);
288 continue;
289 }
290​
291 validCount++;
292​
293 // Not enough valid values yet
294 if (validCount < period)
295 {
296 results.Add(null);
297 continue;
298 }
299​
300 // Bootstrap with SMA of last 'period' valid values
301 if (validCount == period)
302 {
303 decimal sum = 0;
304 int count = 0;
305 for (int j = i; j >= 0 && count < period; j--)
306 {
307 if (source[j].HasValue)
308 {
309 sum += source[j]!.Value;
310 count++;
311 }
312 }
313 prevEma = count > 0 ? sum / count : null;
314 results.Add(prevEma);
315 continue;
316 }
317​
318 // Recursive EMA
319 if (prevEma.HasValue)
320 {
321 decimal ema = (source[i]!.Value - prevEma.Value) * k + prevEma.Value;
322 results.Add(ema);
323 prevEma = ema;
324 }
325 else
326 {
327 results.Add(null);
328 }
329 }
330 }
331​
332 // =============================================================================
333 // Logic Explanation: Static Convenience Wrapper
334 //
335 // [IPO Block]
336 // Input: IEnumerable<CandleData>, period parameters
337 // Process: Creates instance, runs Calculate()
338 // Output: Tuple of (MACD Line, Signal Line, Histogram)
339 // =============================================================================
340 public static (List<decimal?> macd, List<decimal?> signal, List<decimal?> histogram) Calculate(
341 IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int shortPeriod = 12, int longPeriod = 26, int signalPeriod = 9)
342 {
343 var macd = new MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence(shortPeriod, longPeriod, signalPeriod);
344 macd.Calculate(candles);
345 return (macd.MacdLine, macd.SignalLine, macd.Histogram);
346 }
347 }
348}

28 self.signal_line.clear()

36
37 # Rationale: Calculate MACD (Fast - Slow)
38 for i in range(len(candles)):
39 if i < len(short_ema) and i < len(long_ema) and short_ema[i] is not None and long_ema[i] is not None:
40 self.macd_line.append(short_ema[i] - long_ema[i])
41 else:
42 self.macd_line.append(None)
43

45 self._calc_ema_from_values(self.macd_line, self.signal_period, self.signal_line)
46

48 for i in range(len(self.macd_line)):
49 if self.macd_line[i] is not None and i < len(self.signal_line) and self.signal_line[i] is not None:
50 self.histogram.append(self.macd_line[i] - self.signal_line[i])
51 else:
52 self.histogram.append(None)
53​
54 def _calc_ema(self, candles, period):
55 # Internal helper calling standard EMA
56 return calc_ema(candles, period)
57​
58 def _calc_ema_from_values(self, source, period, results):
59 # Logic matches C# CalculateEmaFromValues
60 results.clear()
61 if len(source) == 0 or period <= 0:
62 return
63
64 k = 2.0 / (period + 1)
65 prev_ema = None
66 valid_count = 0
67
68 for i in range(len(source)):
69 if source[i] is None:
70 results.append(None)
71 continue
72
73 valid_count += 1
74 if valid_count < period:
75 results.append(None)
76 continue
77
78 if valid_count == period:
79 # Seeding with SMA of valid values
80 s = 0
81 count = 0
82 j = i
83 # Backtrack to find 'period' valid numbers
84 while j >= 0 and count < period:
85 if source[j] is not None:
86 s += source[j]
87 count += 1
88 j -= 1
89
90 prev_ema = s / count if count > 0 else None
91 results.append(prev_ema)
92 continue
93
94 # Recursive EMA
95 if prev_ema is not None:
96 ema = (source[i] - prev_ema) * k + prev_ema
97 results.append(ema)
98 prev_ema = ema
99 else:
100 results.append(None)

105 macd.calculate(candles)

1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (Moving Average Convergence Divergence)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# MACD (Moving Average Convergence Divergence). We explain *why* code is
7# written this way and *how* data transforms line-by-line, targeting
8# programming beginners.
9#
10# [Core Concepts]
11# 1. Convergence/Divergence
12# - Convergence: The Fast EMA moves towards the Slow EMA (momentum decreasing).
13# - Divergence: The Fast EMA moves away from the Slow EMA (momentum increasing).
14# - This relationship reveals the strength and direction of a trend.
15#
16# 2. Three Component System
17# - MACD Line: The core metric (Fast EMA - Slow EMA).
18# - Signal Line: A smoothed average of the MACD Line itself (EMA of MACD).
19# - Histogram: The difference between MACD Line and Signal Line (Visualizes momentum).
20#
21# 3. Standard Configuration
22# - Fast Period (12): Represents short-term price action.
23# - Slow Period (26): Represents medium-term trend.
24# - Signal Period (9): Smoothes the MACD line to generate buy/sell signals.
25#
26# =============================================================================
27​
28# -------------------------------------------------------------
29# Type-Level Explanation: MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence (class)
30#
31# [Why] Encapsulates the complex state of three interacting series.
32# [What] A trend-following momentum indicator.
33# [Who] Used by traders for Signal Line crossovers and Zero Line crossovers.
34# [Where] Stored in the 'Indicators' namespace usually.
35# -------------------------------------------------------------
36class MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence:
37​
38 # -------------------------------------------------------------
39 # Variable Definition: macd_line
40 #
41 # [Role]
42 # Primary Output. Stores the difference between Short and Long EMAs.
43 # Pattern: Oscillator that fluctuates above/below zero.
44 #
45 # [Type Choice]
46 # List[float] (nullable) because earlier values might be undefined (None).
47 # -------------------------------------------------------------
48 # macd_line = []
49​
50 # -------------------------------------------------------------
51 # Variable Definition: signal_line
52 #
53 # [Role]
54 # Secondary Output. A moving average of the macd_line.
55 # Acts as a "trigger" line for buy/sell signals.
56 #
57 # [Type Choice]
58 # List[float] (nullable).
59 # -------------------------------------------------------------
60 # signal_line = []
61​
62 # -------------------------------------------------------------
63 # Variable Definition: histogram
64 #
65 # [Role]
66 # Tertiary Output. Represents the gap between MACD and Signal.
67 # Positive = Bullish momentum. Negative = Bearish momentum.
68 #
69 # [Type Choice]
70 # List[float] (nullable).
71 # -------------------------------------------------------------
72 # histogram = []
73​
74 # -------------------------------------------------------------
75 # Constructor: __init__
76 #
77 # [Why]
78 # To establish the indicator's sensitivity (Short/Long periods)
79 # and smoothing (Signal period) before processing data.
80 #
81 # [Fail Fast]
82 # We validate inputs immediately to prevent "silent failures"
83 # or division-by-zero errors later in the calculation.
84 # -------------------------------------------------------------
85 def __init__(self, short_period=12, long_period=26, signal_period=9):
86 # -------------------------------------------------------------
87 # Logic Step 1: Input Validation
88 #
89 # [Decision]
90 # Are the periods positive numbers?
91 #
92 # [True Branch]
93 # Periods are valid. Continue.
94 #
95 # [False Branch]
96 # Raise ValueError. Negative periods make no mathematical sense.
97 # -------------------------------------------------------------
98 if short_period <= 0 or long_period <= 0 or signal_period <= 0:
99 raise ValueError("All periods must be positive.")
100​
101 # -------------------------------------------------------------
102 # Logic Step 2: Logical Consistency Check
103 #
104 # [Decision]
105 # Is the Short Period actually shorter than or equal to Long Period?
106 #
107 # [True Branch]
108 # Configuration is logical.
109 #
110 # [False Branch]
111 # Raise ValueError. Swapped periods would invert the indicator's meaning.
112 # -------------------------------------------------------------
113 if short_period >= long_period:
114 raise ValueError("short_period must be less than long_period.")
115​
116 self.short_period = short_period
117 self.long_period = long_period
118 self.signal_period = signal_period
119
120 # Initialize output containers
121 self.macd_line = []
122 self.signal_line = []
123 self.histogram = []
124​
125 # =============================================================================
126 # IPO: calculate
127 # =============================================================================
128 #
129 # [Input]
130 # - candles: List[dict] (Each dict contains 'close' price)
131 #
132 # [Process]
133 # 1. Compute Short EMA (Fast Trend).
134 # 2. Compute Long EMA (Slow Trend).
135 # 3. Subtract Long from Short to get MACD Line.
136 # 4. Compute EMA of *MACD Line* to get Signal Line.
137 # 5. Subtract Signal from MACD to get Histogram.
138 #
139 # [Output]
140 # - None (Results are stored in instance variables).
141 # =============================================================================
142 def calculate(self, candles):
143
144 # -------------------------------------------------------------
145 # Logic Step 1: Reset State
146 #
147 # [Why]
148 # Ensures clean state if the instance is reused for new data.
149 # -------------------------------------------------------------
150 self.macd_line.clear()
151 self.signal_line.clear()
152 self.histogram.clear()
153
154 # -------------------------------------------------------------
155 # Logic Step 2: Empty Data Check
156 #
157 # [Decision]
158 # Do we have any data to process?
159 # -------------------------------------------------------------
160 if len(candles) == 0:
161 return
162​
163 # -------------------------------------------------------------
164 # Logic Step 3: Calculate Component EMAs
165 #
166 # [Why]
167 # MACD is a "derivative" indicator; it is derived from other indicators
168 # (EMAs), not directly from price alone.
169 # -------------------------------------------------------------
170 short_ema = self._calc_ema(candles, self.short_period)
171 long_ema = self._calc_ema(candles, self.long_period)
172​
173 # -------------------------------------------------------------
174 # Logic Step 4: Compute MACD Line (Loop)
175 #
176 # [Action]
177 # Subtract Slow Trend from Fast Trend.
178 #
179 # [Visual]
180 # i=0: Short=None, Long=None -> MACD=None
181 # ...
182 # i=30: Short=105, Long=100 -> MACD=5.0 (Bullish)
183 # -------------------------------------------------------------
184 for i in range(len(candles)):
185
186 # [Decision] Are both EMAs available?
187 # We need both values to compute the difference.
188 if (i < len(short_ema) and i < len(long_ema) and
189 short_ema[i] is not None and long_ema[i] is not None):
190
191 # Logic Step 4.1: Subtraction
192 val = short_ema[i] - long_ema[i]
193 self.macd_line.append(val)
194 else:
195 self.macd_line.append(None)
196​
197 # -------------------------------------------------------------
198 # Logic Step 5: Compute Signal Line
199 #
200 # [How]
201 # We recursively apply EMA logic to the *MACD Line* we just built.
202 # Note: We use a specialized helper that accepts a list of numbers (values),
203 # not candles.
204 # -------------------------------------------------------------
205 self._calc_ema_from_values(self.macd_line, self.signal_period, self.signal_line)
206​
207 # -------------------------------------------------------------
208 # Logic Step 6: Compute Histogram (Loop)
209 #
210 # [Action]
211 # Subtract Signal Line from MACD Line.
212 #
213 # [Visual]
214 # MACD=5.0, Signal=4.0 -> Hist=1.0 (Momentum Up)
215 # MACD=4.0, Signal=4.5 -> Hist=-0.5 (Momentum Down)
216 # -------------------------------------------------------------
217 for i in range(len(self.macd_line)):
218
219 # [Decision] Do we have both components?
220 if (self.macd_line[i] is not None and
221 i < len(self.signal_line) and
222 self.signal_line[i] is not None):
223
224 # Logic Step 6.1: Subtraction
225 hist_val = self.macd_line[i] - self.signal_line[i]
226 self.histogram.append(hist_val)
227 else:
228 self.histogram.append(None)

230 # =============================================================================
231 # IPO: _calc_ema (Private Helper)
232 # =============================================================================
233 #
234 # [Input]
235 # - candles: List[dict] (Source data)
236 # - period: int (Lookback)
237 #
238 # [Process]
239 # 1. Determine Weighting Multiplier 'k'.
240 # 2. Iterate through candles.
241 # 3. For first valid point, use SMA as seed.
242 # 4. For subsequent points, use EMA formula: (Price - Prev) * k + Prev.
243 #
244 # [Output]
245 # - List[float] (The EMA series)
246 # =============================================================================
247 def _calc_ema(self, candles, period):
248 results = []
249 if len(candles) == 0 or period <= 0:
250 return results
251
252 # -------------------------------------------------------------
253 # Logic Step 1: Calculate Multiplier (Weight)
254 #
255 # [Why]
256 # Controls how much weight recent prices get.
257 # k = 2 / (N + 1) is the standard EMA smoothing factor.
258 # -------------------------------------------------------------
259 k = 2.0 / (period + 1)
260 prev_ema = None
261
262 # -------------------------------------------------------------
263 # Logic Step 2: Main Loop
264 # -------------------------------------------------------------
265 for i in range(len(candles)):
266
267 # Logic Step 2.1: Skip insufficient data
268 if i < period - 1:
269 results.append(None)
270 continue
271
272 # Logic Step 2.2: Initial Seed (SMA)
273 # EMA requires a starting value. We use the SMA of the first 'period'
274 # candles as the seed.
275 if i == period - 1:
276 s = sum(candles[i - j]['close'] for j in range(period))
277 prev_ema = s / period
278 results.append(prev_ema)
279 continue
280
281 # Logic Step 2.3: EMA Calculation
282 # [Visual]
283 # PrevEMA=100, Price=110, k=0.1
284 # EMA = (110 - 100)*0.1 + 100 = 101.0
285 if prev_ema is not None:
286 ema = (candles[i]['close'] - prev_ema) * k + prev_ema
287 results.append(ema)
288 prev_ema = ema
289 else:
290 results.append(None)
291
292 return results
293​
294 # =============================================================================
295 # IPO: _calc_ema_from_values (Private Helper)
296 # =============================================================================
297 #
298 # [Input]
299 # - source: List[float] (The MACD Line values)
300 # - period: int (Signal Period)
301 # - results: List[float] (Output list to populate)
302 #
303 # [Process]
304 # Identical to _calc_ema but handles 'None' values in the source list
305 # (since macd_line has leading Nones).
306 #
307 # [Output]
308 # - None (Modifies 'results' in-place)
309 # =============================================================================
310 def _calc_ema_from_values(self, source, period, results):
311 results.clear()
312 if len(source) == 0 or period <= 0:
313 return
314​
315 k = 2.0 / (period + 1)
316 prev_ema = None
317 valid_count = 0
318
319 # -------------------------------------------------------------
320 # Logic Step 1: Sequential Processing
321 # -------------------------------------------------------------
322 for i in range(len(source)):
323 val = source[i]
324
325 # Case A: Source is missing
326 if val is None:
327 results.append(None)
328 continue
329
330 # Case B: Accumulating valid data for Seed
331 valid_count += 1
332 if valid_count < period:
333 results.append(None)
334 continue
335
336 # Case C: Create Seed (SMA)
337 if valid_count == period:
338 # Calculate SMA of the first 'period' valid numbers
339 # We backtrack to find them.
340 s = 0
341 count = 0
342 j = i
343 while j >= 0 and count < period:
344 if source[j] is not None:
345 s += source[j]
346 count += 1
347 j -= 1
348
349 prev_ema = s / count if count > 0 else None
350 results.append(prev_ema)
351 continue
352​
353 # Case D: Calculate EMA
354 if prev_ema is not None:
355 ema = (val - prev_ema) * k + prev_ema
356 results.append(ema)
357 prev_ema = ema
358 else:
359 results.append(None)
360​
